@graph.description: Soft, fluffy No Knead Cinnamon Rolls made without overnight rising, no stand mixer and no kneading. These are magical - and easy! Quick recipe video included.

itemListElement.name: Home
Baking Recipes
No Knead Cinnamon Rolls

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: No Knead Cinnamon Rolls
@graph.description: Soft, fluffy cinnamon rolls made from scratch with a dump-and-mix dough that requires no kneading! Frosted with a sticky cream cheese glaze, these are sweet but nowhere near as sickly sweet as store bought ones. This recipe is quite forgiving - see notes. Instructions are long because I'm providing helpful hints but this recipe is actually quite straight forward! Recipe video below.
recipeIngredient: 70 g / 1/3 cup  caster sugar ((superfine sugar), or sub with normal white sugar)
600 g / 20 oz  plain flour / all purpose flour ((4 1/2 US Cups, 4 Cups everywhere else exc Japan) (Note 3))
1 cup / 250 ml  milk (, lukewarm, whole or low fat, (Note 2))
50 g / 3.5 tbsp  unsalted butter (, melted and slightly cooled)
1/4 cup / 35g  plain flour ((all purpose flour), plus more as required)
1 1/4 cups / 150g  soft icing sugar / powdered sugar

itemListElement.text: Place the yeast and 2 teaspoons of the sugar in a medium bowl, then pour in water. Leave for 5 minutes until it froths.
itemListElement.name: Place the yeast and 2 teaspoons of the sugar in a medium bowl, then pour in water. Leave for 5 minutes until it froths.

itemListElement.text: Place 600g/20oz flour, remaining sugar and salt in a bowl. Mix to combine.
itemListElement.name: Place 600g/20oz flour, remaining sugar and salt in a bowl. Mix to combine.

itemListElement.text: Make a well in the centre. Add milk, butter, eggs and pour in the yeast liquid, including all froth.
itemListElement.name: Make a well in the centre. Add milk, butter, eggs and pour in the yeast liquid, including all froth.

itemListElement.text: Mix until combined with wooden spoon - it will be like a sticky muffin batter, not kneadable.
itemListElement.name: Mix until combined with wooden spoon - it will be like a sticky muffin batter, not kneadable.

itemListElement.text: Rise # 1: Cover with cling wrap and place in a warm place (25C/77F+) to rise for around 1 1/4 - 1 1/2 hrs or until almost tripled in volume. (Note 4) Dough surface should be bubbly (see video or photos in post).
itemListElement.name: Rise # 1: Cover with cling wrap and place in a warm place (25C/77F+) to rise for around 1 1/4 - 1 1/2 hrs or until almost tripled in volume. (Note 4) Dough surface should be bubbly (see video or photos in post).

itemListElement.text: Line a 31.5 x 23.5 cm / 9 x 13" tray with baking paper with overhang.
itemListElement.name: Line a 31.5 x 23.5 cm / 9 x 13" tray with baking paper with overhang.

itemListElement.text: Mix cinnamon and sugar in a bowl.
itemListElement.name: Mix cinnamon and sugar in a bowl.

itemListElement.text: Uncover dough, mix with spoon to deflate.
itemListElement.name: Uncover dough, mix with spoon to deflate.

itemListElement.text: Sprinkle half Extra Flour on work surface, pour dough on, sprinkle over remaining Extra Flour. Use hands to incorporate the flour into the dough - it may not absorb it all (or need more), the dough will stop absorbing flour when it's no longer sticky, should be soft, pliable.
itemListElement.name: Sprinkle half Extra Flour on work surface, pour dough on, sprinkle over remaining Extra Flour. Use hands to incorporate the flour into the dough - it may not absorb it all (or need more), the dough will stop absorbing flour when it's no longer sticky, should be soft, pliable.

itemListElement.text: If work surface is now flour free, sprinkle with more flour.
itemListElement.name: If work surface is now flour free, sprinkle with more flour.

itemListElement.text: Shape dough into log, then roll out into 28 x 48 cm / 11 x 19" rectangle.
itemListElement.name: Shape dough into log, then roll out into 28 x 48 cm / 11 x 19" rectangle.

itemListElement.text: Pour over butter, then brush all over, then sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.
itemListElement.name: Pour over butter, then brush all over, then sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.

itemListElement.text: Roll up firmly, then shape into an even log.
itemListElement.name: Roll up firmly, then shape into an even log.

itemListElement.text: Cut into 12 pieces (4cm / 1.6"), then place on tray (3 x 4).
itemListElement.name: Cut into 12 pieces (4cm / 1.6"), then place on tray (3 x 4).

itemListElement.text: Cover with tea towel then place in warm place for 40 minutes or until almost doubled.
itemListElement.name: Cover with tea towel then place in warm place for 40 minutes or until almost doubled.

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 180C/350F (standard) or 160C/320F (fan / convection). Place shelf in the middle of the oven.
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 180C/350F (standard) or 160C/320F (fan / convection). Place shelf in the middle of the oven.

itemListElement.text: Bake for 20 minutes, rotating the tray at 16 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Bake for 20 minutes, rotating the tray at 16 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Buns are ready when the middle rolls are golden and the outer ones are deep golden on the edges. Tap the middle ones - they should sound hollow.
itemListElement.name: Buns are ready when the middle rolls are golden and the outer ones are deep golden on the edges. Tap the middle ones - they should sound hollow.

itemListElement.text: Optional: Brush with 1 tbsp / 15g melted butter to remove any residual flour spots.
itemListElement.name: Optional: Brush with 1 tbsp / 15g melted butter to remove any residual flour spots.

itemListElement.text: Use paper overhang to lift rolls onto cooling rack (key step - Note 5). Cool for 1 hour (will still be warm).
itemListElement.name: Use paper overhang to lift rolls onto cooling rack (key step - Note 5). Cool for 1 hour (will still be warm).

itemListElement.text: Use a spoon to frost with glaze. Best served warm!
itemListElement.name: Use a spoon to frost with glaze. Best served warm!

itemListElement.text: Place butter, cream cheese and vanilla in a bowl. Beat until smooth (10 - 15 seconds).
itemListElement.name: Place butter, cream cheese and vanilla in a bowl. Beat until smooth (10 - 15 seconds).

itemListElement.text: Add icing sugar, beat to incorporate. Add enough milk to make it a consistency that can be spooned over the buns and it drips slightly (see video).
itemListElement.name: Add icing sugar, beat to incorporate. Add enough milk to make it a consistency that can be spooned over the buns and it drips slightly (see video).
